Key Arguments: The legislation is elitist, exempting mainstream media and government from misinformation classification.
It imposes excessive regulatory burdens on independent platforms like Substack, potentially leading to censorship.
The law transforms digital platforms into censors, forcing them to determine what constitutes misinformation.
The penalties for non-compliance are severe, leading to a chilling effect on free speech.
Existing laws can address real-world harms caused by misinformation without new regulations.
The legislation could stifle free speech and the development of new information dissemination platforms.
Main Themes: Potential ineffectiveness and unintended consequences of the law
